column10: Improving economies and market mechanisms to benefit society or the environment

column12: Providing access to markets for previously excluded people
Improving and enforcing market regulatory requirements to benefit society or the environment

column14: Regulation of the sale of marine resources

column18: Elimination of subsidies which encourage overfishing and illegal, unregulated fishing

column12: Establishing economic incentives to reward behaviours that benefit society or the environment (e.g. thematic investments, subsidies)

column14: Increasing third-party investment in forest conservation

column12: Removing economic incentives that harm society or the environment (e.g. subsidies, tariffs)

column14: Removing or reducing fossil fuel subsidies

column12: Providing markets with information necessary to make sustainable purchase decisions (e.g. product certifications, information technologies).

column14: Integration of sustainability performance into corporate annual reports

column12: Establishing voluntary agreements which benefit society or the environment (e.g. industry standards, working groups)

column14: Encouraging companies to report on sustainability performance

column10: Improving governance (international, national, local or corporate) to benefit society or the environment

column12: Promoting greater or more equal participation in decision-making in other institutions

column14: Increasing participation of developing countries in global governance

column12: Increasing accountability in other institutions (i.e. taking full ownership and responsibility for actions)
Increasing responsiveness in other institutions (i.e. enabling adaptation to address society's changing needs)

column14: Implementing climate change adaptation and mitigation measures and planning

column12: Increasing responsibility in other institutions (i.e. helping them safeguard human rights and the environment)
Increasing transparency in other institutions (i.e. information relating to decisions is readily available and accessible)
Reducing bribery and corruption in other institutions
